question: What systems were affected by the scheduled electrical maintenance from June 6 to June 10, 2025?
answer: The Béluga and Narval compute nodes, as well as cloud instances in the Juno Cloud (non-High Availability zone), were shut down.

question: When did the electrical maintenance requiring shutdown of Béluga and Narval compute nodes begin on June 6, 2025?
answer: The shutdown began at 9:00 a.m. (EDT) on June 6, 2025.

question: What was the end time for the electrical maintenance on Béluga, Narval, and Juno (non-HA) that started on June 6, 2025?
answer: The maintenance concluded at 12:00 p.m. (noon) on June 10, 2025.

question: What happened to jobs scheduled to finish after 9:00 a.m. on June 6 during the electrical maintenance?
answer: Jobs scheduled to finish after 9:00 a.m. on June 6 remained queued until the clusters were back online.

question: How were cloud instances on Béluga Cloud and in the Juno Cloud HA zone affected during the June 6-10 electrical maintenance?
answer: Cloud instances on Béluga Cloud and in the Juno Cloud HA zone experienced short access outages.

question: How was storage on Béluga and Narval affected during the June 6-10 electrical maintenance?
answer: Storage systems on Béluga and Narval remained accessible via Globus and login nodes but saw intermittent disruptions due to the work.

question: What was the reason for the shutdown of Béluga and Narval compute nodes on April 30, 2025?
answer: Scheduled electrical maintenance required the shutdown of Béluga and Narval compute nodes.

question: When did the electrical maintenance on Béluga, Narval, and Juno (non-HA) start on April 30, 2025?
answer: The maintenance started at 12:00 PM (EDT) on April 30, 2025.

question: How long did the electrical maintenance on Béluga, Narval, and Juno (non-HA) last from April 30, 2025?
answer: It lasted for 1 day, until 12:00 PM (EDT) on May 1, 2025.

question: Were Béluga cloud instances affected by the electrical maintenance on April 30-May 1, 2025?
answer: No, these interruptions did not affect Béluga cloud instances or Juno cloud instances in the high availability zone.

question: How could users access Béluga and Narval storage during the April 30-May 1, 2025 outage?
answer: Béluga and Narval storage remained accessible through Globus and the login nodes of each cluster.

question: Why was the Cedar cluster completely unavailable from March 31 to April 2, 2025?
answer: A planned outage was required to perform power modifications as part of the preparations for bringing new equipment online.

question: What happened to jobs running on the Cedar cluster during the March 31-April 2, 2025 outage?
answer: Any jobs running at the time of the outage were terminated and had to be re-submitted once the cluster came back online.

question: Was Cedar Cloud operational during the Cedar cluster outage from March 31 to April 2, 2025?
answer: Yes, Cedar Cloud remained operational during this period.

question: What caused the complete data center shutdown for Graham starting December 7, 2024?
answer: Ongoing renovations require a complete data center shutdown.

question: What services were unavailable during the Graham outage beginning December 7, 2024?
answer: All Graham cluster services, storage, and cloud services will be entirely unavailable.

question: When was the Graham outage, originally scheduled from Dec 7, 2024, extended to?
answer: The outage was extended to February 24, 2025.

question: Where can users find updated information about the Graham outage extension?
answer: For updated information, users can see https://status.alliancecan.ca.

question: What was the reason for the temporary reduction in capacity for Béluga and Narval starting January 13, 2025?
answer: Performance and stability tests on Rorqual required the shutdown of all Béluga compute nodes and about half of Narval compute nodes.

question: How were Béluga compute nodes affected starting January 13, 2025?
answer: All Béluga compute nodes were shut down.

question: What percentage of Narval compute nodes were shut down during the temporary reduction starting January 13, 2025?
answer: Approximately 50% of Narval nodes from each category (CPU, GPU, and large memory) were shut down.

question: What happened to Béluga Storage during the temporary reduction from January 13 to January 31, 2025?
answer: Béluga Storage was mounted to Narval (/lustre01, /lustre02, /lustre03, /lustre04 of Beluga).

question: Were Béluga and Juno cloud instances affected by the temporary reduction starting January 13, 2025?
answer: No, Béluga and Juno cloud instances are unaffected.

question: What was the updated capacity status for Narval after January 30, 2025, regarding the temporary reduction?
answer: Narval's compute capacity was at 100% until February 6, then again at 30% for the last Rorqual tests.

question: When were Béluga and Narval expected to be back to 100% capacity after the temporary reduction?
answer: Béluga and Narval should be back to 100% capacity on February 14.

question: Why were Niagara and Mist compute nodes shut down on January 22, 2025?
answer: To support ongoing system improvements and the integration with the new system, Trillium.

question: What was the duration of the Niagara and Mist compute node shutdown on January 22, 2025?
answer: The shutdown was from 8 AM to 5 PM EST on January 22, 2025.

question: Which systems remained available during the Niagara and Mist compute node shutdown on January 22, 2025?
answer: The login nodes, file systems, and the HPSS system will remain available.

question: What happened to submitted jobs during the Niagara and Mist outage on January 22, 2025?
answer: The scheduler will hold jobs that are submitted until the maintenance has finished.

question: What was the reason for the Cedar compute cluster shutdown starting January 13, 2025?
answer: The Cedar compute cluster will be shut down in preparation for the infrastructure renewal.

question: When was the Cedar compute cluster expected to be fully operational again after the January 13, 2025 shutdown?
answer: The cluster will be fully operational on January 21.

question: What was migrated during the Cedar compute cluster shutdown starting January 13, 2025?
answer: The Cedar /scratch filesystem will be migrated to new storage.

question: What action were users advised to take regarding their data during the Cedar shutdown starting January 13, 2025?
answer: Users should move any important data immediately to their /project, /nearline, or /home directory.

question: Did Cedar cloud remain operational during the Cedar compute cluster shutdown from January 13 to January 21, 2025?
answer: Yes, Cedar cloud will remain operational during this period.
